New Records: Wyatt Langford hit the first walk-off grand slam struck by a Rangers rookie in franchise history.
The eighth regular-season walk-off grand slam in franchise history
The first walk-off grand slam for the Rangers, including the postseason, since Nelson Cruz in Game 2 of the 2011 ALCS
Key Match Events: Wyatt Langford hit a Statcast-projected 407 foot walk-off grand slam to stun New York and send the Rangers home winners with a 7-4 walk-off victory
Post-Match Reflections: Manager Bruce Bochy said of Langford: 'He's been there, and he's come through a few times like that. We had the right guy up there, good swings. He was all set up by some good at-bats before that. He has a knack for getting a hit when we need it.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rangers have now won via walk-off in three straight wins and six of their last seven home victories.
The Rangers have nine walk-off wins this season, tied for the club's most since 2010 (when it had 11) and more than the total for the past two seasons combined (four in 2023, three in 2022)
Others: Langford alone has recorded a team-high three walk-off hits this season, becoming the first Ranger with as many as three walk-off hits in a single campaign since Josh Hamilton in 2011 (also three).
